intro: Crotalaria engleri, commonly known as the African leadplant, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces striking yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, with a distinctive appearance. Crotalaria engleri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and woodland edges.
